data.title: year review 2000 (www.quoticker.de)
data.text:
"ROCKIN' ALL OVER THE YEARS" - Status Quo in the year 2000

The year 2000 - Status Quo rockin the new millenium. A new cover album "Famous in the last century" and 2 singles were released. But the new year also brought personal changes. Jeff Rich, Status Quo's drummer, decided to leave the band after 15 years. A new drummer was found in Matt Letley. Then Andy Bown retired from live work for personal reasons. His substitute was keyboard player Paul Hirsh. Bass player John "Rhino" Edwards released his first solo-album. A highly regarded documentary of the band was broadcasted in british TV around Eastern. And the new Millenium saw the release of some Status Quo compilations. And on the live front the band played a UK-tour in 2 parts interrupted by an Australian tour.

All known shows of the year 2000: ...more

Pictures: CD "Rockin all over the world" (D) - CD "Collection 2000" (Ru) - CD "Famous in the last century" (AUS) CD "Rhinos Revenge" - CD "The Collection 2000" (Marks & Spencer) - CD "Break the Rules" (D) - CD "Grandes Mitos" (E).
